result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett M Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!

miscConds.notes:
The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Upon successful completion of the terms/conditions of this sentence (including payment of all financial obligations) and supervision followed with a letter confirming successful completion from DOC, this record would be expunged!

Def is to enroll in and successfully complete the Ashland Adult Drug Court Program.
  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
  Any contraband seized to be forfeited!
Def to have NO contact w/Jordon Foqua & Joshua Carrington.

While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
Added to current pymt plan.

judgments.dispoDesc: probation revoked and sentence is imposed
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served in the amount of 74 days as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department
Granted good time
Granted work release
Concurrent with: 15CF133 and 15CF173
Civil Judgement is now entered for fines. Payment plan of $25 a month beginning 11/1/18

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett M Nelson

records.addlTxt: of failure to meet conditions for expungement

Defendant Brett M Nelson in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Was put on probation.- Probation is now revoked. State's motion remove def from Drug Court is granted. No agreement on sentencing. State comments-- 15CF133 is another case the Def had. Def plead and got 180 days jail which were stayed. 15CF133- lift stay on the 155 days. Ct orders stay lifted and prev imposed  jail needs to be served. State comments on convictions  are the def's only convictions. DOC recommends 12 months jail. Atty comments on sentencing, Def comments on sentencing. Ct comments on sentencing . 
Ct orders- 220 days run concurrent and concurrent  to 15CF133, 15CF115- 74 days credit and 73 in the other case. Work release, Good time., pay COC now, civil judgment. Payment plan -$25 a month beginning 11/1/18.
15CF133- granted credit for 37 days, granted good time, work release.
